data.description: Artificial Intelligence Intern - Perception for Robotics jobs in United StatesOverviewCompanyThis job has closed.APPLY to similar jobsFamiliar Machines & Magic · 2 weeks agoArtificial Intelligence Intern - Perception for RoboticsWoburn, MAInternshipOnsiteInternFamiliar Machines and Magic, Inc. is a Massachusetts-based company focused on using robotics and AI to create artificial life. They are seeking a highly motivated AI Intern to develop and implement perception models that run reliably on robots, contributing directly to their product and research direction.Information Technology & ServicesH1B Sponsor LikelyResponsibilitiesBuild and deploy multimodal perception systems using deep learning and traditional computer vision / signal processing methodsTrain and evaluate models on real datasets and support integration onto robot hardwareImprove model performance, robustness, and runtime efficiencyIterate quickly with strong engineering practices (clean code, reproducible experiments)Work closely with roboticists, software engineers, and designers to turn cutting-edge research into a robust, production-ready perception pipelineQualificationDeep LearningPythonC++Perception ModelsRoboticsCommunicatorCollaborative TeammateCuriousProactiveHands-on MindsetRequiredCurrently pursuing a Master's or Ph.D. in Robotics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related technical fieldAuthorized to work in the US (citizen or already has visa/work authorization)Able to start ASAP (by February)Prior experience developing perception models (e.g., implemented/applied on a robot and/or real dataset)Strong deep learning backgroundStrong programming skills in Python and C++Hands-on mindset: you enjoy building, debugging, and making things work end-to-endComfortable with rapid iteration in a fast-paced environmentPreferredPrior experience in HRI, robotics, or embodied AIPrior research experience, with publications or submissions in top venues (e.g., ICML, NeurIPS, ICRA, IROS, HRI, RSS, CVPR, CHI)Familiarity with low-resource / compute-constrained systemsFamiliarity with VLMs and LLMsCompanyFamiliar Machines & MagicFamiliar Machines & Magic is creating artificial life to build a more caring world.Boston, Massachusetts, US11-50 employeeshttps://www.familiarmachines.com/H1B SponsorshipFamiliar Machines & Magic has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.
